title: Can't turn off sound for "missed call" notification
content:
New problem that just showed up in the last day or so on my Pixel 3 with Android 11:

It plays a sound every time there's a "missed notification" call. I get a lot of these because of spam callers. The phone isn't ringing or anything because I have it set to screen them. I just get a "missed call" notification out of the blue, and a distracting sound. It sounds like the same sound used for "low battery" notifications.

When I slide the notification to the side and click on the gear, it says "These notifications can't be modified":

I can go into the notification settings and go into the detailed settings for "Missed calls":

 
"Sound: None" would seem to imply that it should play no sound.

Earlier today the Vibration switch was on, but I wasn't getting vibrations with these notifications. I turned it off, and still get the sound.

The "Silent" button at the top is disabled.

It's also not possible to disable all phone notifications, if I go back out one level from this screen.

I've looked at settings within the Phone app, and can't find anything relevant, except I guess "Ring & notification volume" (I don't want to silence phone rings all the time) and "Do Not Disturb" (same). There's a "Default notification sound", but that's set to a completely different sound than the one I'm getting.

Getting pretty annoyed by this. I'm guessing it's just a bug.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3
